statements.name: PROC PSMATCH
statements.description: provides tools for propensity score analysis
statements.help:
PROC PSMATCH <options>;                 
	ASSESS <ALLCOV><LPS><PS><VAR=(var-list)></ assess-options> ;                 
	CLASS  variables;                 
	EWEIGHT  TREATVAR=treatvar<(trt-option)> BALANCEVARS=(variables </moments-option>) <options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	ID  variables;                 
	MATCH <options>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT <(OBS=obs-value)>=SAS-data-set<keyword=name<keyword=name...>> ;                 
	PSDATA  TREATVAR=treatvar<(TREATED='level' | keyword)>ps-option;                 
	PSMODEL treatvar<(trt-option)> = <effects></ WEIGHT=weight> ;                 
	STRATA <options>;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input SAS data set

arguments.name: REGION=
arguments.description: specifies an interval region of propensity scores (or equivalently, logits of propensity scores) that determines which observations are used in stratification and matching

arguments.name: REGION=
arguments.description: selects all available observations

arguments.name: PSMIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum propensity score in the support region, where pmin is greater than or equal to 0

arguments.name: PSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum propensity score in the support region, where pmax is less than or equal to 1

arguments.name: REGION=
arguments.description: selects observations whose propensity scores (or equivalently, logits of propensity scores) lie in the region of common support for the treated and control groups

arguments.name: EXTEND
arguments.description: extends the lower and upper ends of the common support region for the support region by p, where p is greater than or equal to 0

arguments.name: DISTANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of the distance that is used to extend the support region

arguments.name: LPS
arguments.description: extends the region by using the logit of the propensity score

arguments.name: PS
arguments.description: extends the region by using the propensity score

arguments.name: MULT=
arguments.description: specifies the multiplier for the extension p to extend the support region

arguments.name: ONE
arguments.description: extends the region by p

arguments.name: MULT
arguments.description: extends the region by p times the pooled estimate of the standard deviation of either LPS (DISTANCE=LPS) or PS (DISTANCE=PS), where this estimate is computed as the square root of the average of the variances in the treated and control groups

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: extends the lower end of the specified region by l, where l is greater than or equal to 0

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: extends the lower end of the specified region by u, where u is greater than or equal to 0

arguments.name: REGION=
arguments.description: selects observations whose propensity scores lie in the region of propensity scores for observations in the treated group

arguments.name: EXTEND
arguments.description: extends the lower and upper ends of the common support region for the support region by p, where p is greater than or equal to 0

arguments.name: DISTANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of the distance that is used to extend the support region

arguments.name: LPS
arguments.description: extends the region by using the logit of the propensity score

arguments.name: PS
arguments.description: extends the region by using the propensity score

arguments.name: MULT=
arguments.description: specifies the multiplier for the extension p to extend the support region

arguments.name: ONE
arguments.description: extends the region by p

arguments.name: MULT
arguments.description: extends the region by p times the pooled estimate of the standard deviation of either LPS (DISTANCE=LPS) or PS (DISTANCE=PS), where this estimate is computed as the square root of the average of the variances in the treated and control groups

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: extends the lower end of the specified region by l, where l is greater than or equal to 0

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: extends the lower end of the specified region by u, where u is greater than or equal to 0

statements.name: ASSESS
statements.description: assesses variable differences between the treated and control groups for all observations and for observations in the support region that is specified in the REGION= option

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: specifies options that control the plots

arguments.name: NODETAILS
arguments.description: displays plots for only two sets of observations: the set of all observations and a second set that depends on specified statements and options

arguments.name: ONLY
arguments.description: suppresses the default plots and displays only plots that are specifically requested

arguments.name: ORIENT=
arguments.description: controls the orientation of the plots

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: requests all applicable plots for all variables that are specified in the ASSESS statement

arguments.name: BAR
arguments.description: requests comparative bar charts for binary classification variables

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: requests bar charts for binary classification variables that are specified by the ALLCOV or VAR= option

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies a subset of the binary classification variables for which bar charts are to be displayed

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: displays frequencies of levels for the binary classification variable

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: displays proportions of levels for the binary classification variable

arguments.name: BOX
arguments.description: requests box plots for continuous variables

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: requests box plots for all continuous variables that are specified by the ALLCOV or VAR= option

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies a subset of the continuous variables for which box plots are to be displayed

arguments.name: CDF
arguments.description: requests cumulative distribution (CDF) plots for continuous variables

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: requests cumulative distribution (CDF) plots for all continuous variables that are specified by the ALLCOV or VAR= option

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies a subset of the continuous variables for which cumulative distribution (CDF) plots are to be displayed

arguments.name: CLOUD
arguments.description: requests cloud plots for continuous variables

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: requests cloud plots for all continuous variables that are specified by the ALLCOV or VAR= option

arguments.name: DISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies a subset of the continuous variables for which cloud plots are to be displayed

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all plots

arguments.name: STDDIFF
arguments.description: requests a standardized mean differences plot for all variables that are specified by the ALLCOV or VAR= option

arguments.name: WGTCLOUD
arguments.description: requests cloud plots for weights

arguments.name: STDBINVAR=
arguments.description: specifies whether to display standardized binary variables in the standardized mean differences table and plot

arguments.name: STDDEV=
arguments.description: specifies the standard deviation used in computing standardized mean differences

arguments.name: POOLED
arguments.description: uses the pooled standard deviation, which is computed as the square root of the average of the sample variances for the treated group and the sample variance for the control group

arguments.name: TREATED
arguments.description: uses the standard deviation of the variable values in the treated group only

arguments.name: ALLOBS=
arguments.description: uses the sample variances that are derived from all observations to compute the standardized mean differences for all observations, for observations in the support region, for stratified observations, and for matched observations

arguments.name: ALLOBS=
arguments.description: uses the variance derived from all observations to compute the standardized mean differences for all observations, uses the variance derived from observations in the support region to compute the standardized mean differences for observations in the support region, uses the variance derived from stratified observations to compute the standardized mean differences for stratified observations, and uses the variance derived from matched observations to compute the standardized mean differences for matched observations

arguments.name: VARINFO
arguments.description: requests a variable information table for the treated and control groups

arguments.name: ALLOCV
arguments.description: requests an assessment of differences in the covariates that are specified in the PSMODEL statement

arguments.name: LPS
arguments.description: requests an assessment of differences in the logit of the propensity score

arguments.name: PS
arguments.description: requests an assessment of differences in the propensity score

arguments.name: VAR=
arguments.description: requests an assessment of differences in the specified list of variables

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: specifies the variable to use as the treatment indicator in the PSDATA, PSMODEL, and EWEIGHT statements and the classification variables that you specify in the VAR= option in the ASSESS statement

arguments.name: BALANCEVARS=
arguments.description: specifies the variables to balance and optionally the number of MOMENTS to balance

arguments.name: TREATVAR=
arguments.description: names the treatment indicator variable, treatvar, and optionally the TREATED level for the binary treatment variable

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: designates the first ordered level as the treated group

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: designates the last ordered level as the treated group

arguments.name: ABSGTOL=
arguments.description: specifies the absolute gradient convergence criterion for the entropy balance dual optimization problem

arguments.name: BALTOL=
arguments.description: specifies the tolerance value to be used to evaluate the balance constraints and determine acceptance of the entropy balance weights

arguments.name: MAXFUNC=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number n of function calls in the optimization process

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number n of iterations in the optimization process

arguments.name: NLARGESTWGT=
arguments.description: displays a table of the observations that have the n most extreme weights

arguments.name: REFWEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the DATA= data set that contains the reference weights to use for the entropy balance optimization problem, and optionally whether or not the target moments and proportions for the entropy balance optimization problem constraints should be weighted by the reference weights

arguments.name: TOTALWEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the total of the entropy balance weights that are computed for a treatment condition

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the observations for which entropy balance weights are computed

arguments.name: CONTROL
arguments.description: computes entropy balance weights only for the units in the control condition, and the target moments are determined by the covariate values of the treated units

arguments.name: ALLOBS
arguments.description: computes entropy balance weights for both the treated and control units by solving two separate optimization problems, and the target moments that define the constraints for both optimization problems are determined by the covariate values of all units

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a variable that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: ID
statements.description: specifies one or more variables whose values identify the observations that are displayed in tables of extreme weights and most matches

statements.name: MATCH
statements.description: matches observations in the control group to observations in the treatment group

arguments.name: CALIPER
arguments.description: specifies the caliper width requirement for matching, where r is either missing or greater than 0

arguments.name: MULT=
arguments.description: specifies the multiplier for the specified caliper width r

arguments.name: ONE
arguments.description: uses r for the caliper width

arguments.name: STDDEV
arguments.description: uses r times the pooled estimate of the standard deviation of the logit of the propensity score (if you specify DISTANCE=LPS) or the propensity score (if you specify DISTANCE=PS), where this estimate is computed as the square root of the average of the variances in the treated and control groups

arguments.name: MAHDISTANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of distance to be used in the caliper width computation if you specify the DISTANCE=MAH option in the MATCH statement

arguments.name: DISTANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of distance to be compared when treated units are matched to control units

arguments.name: LPS
arguments.description: specifies matching that minimizes the difference between the logits of the propensity scores for the two units

arguments.name: PS
arguments.description: specifies matching that minimizes the difference between the propensity scores for the two units

arguments.name: MAH
arguments.description: specifies matching that minimizes the Mahalanobis distance between the two units

arguments.name: LPS
arguments.description: includes the logit of the propensity score

arguments.name: PS
arguments.description: includes the propensity score

arguments.name: VAR=
arguments.description: includes variables in the specified var-list

arguments.name: COV=
arguments.description: specifies the type of covariance matrix in the Mahalanobis distance

arguments.name: CONTROL
arguments.description: uses the covariance matrix that is computed from observations in the control group

arguments.name: IDENTITY
arguments.description: uses the identity matrix, and the resulting distance is the Euclidean distance

arguments.name: POOLED
arguments.description: uses the pooled covariance matrix that is computed from observations in the treated group and observations in the control group

arguments.name: SQRT=
arguments.description: specifies whether to apply the square root transformation to the Mahalanobis distance in the difference computation

arguments.name: EXACT=
arguments.description: specifies classification variables that are to be matched exactly

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method for the matching

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: requests optimal full matching

arguments.name: KMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of control units to be matched with each treated unit, where kmax greater than or equal to 1

arguments.name: KMAXTREATED=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of treated units for each control, where kmaxtrt greater than or equal to 1

arguments.name: KMEAN=
arguments.description: specifies the average number of control units to be matched with each treated unit

arguments.name: PCTCONTROL=
arguments.description: specifies the percentage of the total number of control units to be matched

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: requests greedy nearest neighbor matching, in which each treated unit is sequentially matched with the k nearest control units

arguments.name: K=
arguments.description: specifies the number of matching control units, where k greater than 0, for each treated unit

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the ordering of treated units that are used to find the matching control units

arguments.name: ASCENDING
arguments.description: orders the treated units in ascending order of the propensity score

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: orders the treated units in descending order of the propensity score

arguments.name: RANDOM
arguments.description: orders the treated units in random order of the propensity score, and optionally the SEED= to start the pseudorandom number generator

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: requests optimal fixed ratio matching and optionally the number of matching control units k for each treated unit

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: requests a fixed number k of unique matching control units for each treated unit, where the matched control units are selected with replacement

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: requests optimal variable ratio matching

arguments.name: KMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of control units to be matched with each treated unit, where kmax greater than or equal to 1

arguments.name: KMEAN=
arguments.description: specifies the average number of control units to be matched with each treated unit

arguments.name: KMIN=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum number of control units to be matched with each treated unit

arguments.name: NCONTROL=
arguments.description: specifies the total number of control units to be matched

arguments.name: PCTCONTROL=
arguments.description: specifies the percentage of total control units to be matched

arguments.name: NMATCHMOST=
arguments.description: displays a table of the observations that have the greatest numbers of matches, where n is less than 50

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the type of weight for matched observations
arguments.help: WEIGHT=ATEWGT | ATTWGT | EQUAL | MATCHATEWGT | MATCHATTWGT | MATCHWGT | NONE

arguments.name: ATEWGT
arguments.description: weights the treatment group up to the total size of the matched set

arguments.name: ATTWGT
arguments.description: weights the control group up to the size of the treatment group in the matched set

arguments.name: EQUAL
arguments.description: uses a weight of 1 for all matched observations

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: specifies the output data set and variables

arguments.name: OUT
arguments.description: names the output data set, and optionally specifies the observations to include in the output data set

arguments.name: LPS=
arguments.description: creates and names the variable that provides the logit of the propensity score

arguments.name: MATCHID=
arguments.description: creates and names the variable that provides identification numbers for the matched treated and control units

arguments.name: PS=
arguments.description: creates and names the variable that provides the propensity score

arguments.name: STRATA=
arguments.description: creates and names the variable that numbers the strata

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: creates and names the weight variable

statements.name: PSDATA
statements.description: specifies the variable in the DATA= data set that is the treatment indicator variable and a variable that contains the propensity scores or logits of the propensity scores

arguments.name: TREATVAR=
arguments.description: names the treatment indicator variable, treatvar, which must be a binary classification variable that you specify in the CLASS statement

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: designates the first ordered level as the treated group

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: designates the last ordered level as the treated group

arguments.name: 'level'
arguments.description: specifies the treated level for the binary treatment variable in quotation marks

arguments.name: PS=
arguments.description: names the variable that contains propensity scores, where the variable name must be a variable in the DATA= data set. You must specify either the PS= or the LPS= option, but not both.

arguments.name: LPS=
arguments.description: names the variable that contains logits of propensity scores, where the variable name must be a variable in the DATA= data set. You must specify either the PS= or the LPS= option, but not both.

statements.name: PSMODEL
statements.description: specifies the logistic regression model for computing propensity scores

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies a variable that contains the weight of each observation that is used in fitting the logistic regression model to derive the propensity scores

arguments.name: NLARGESTWGT=
arguments.description: displays a table of the observations that have the most extreme weights, where n is less than or equal to 50

arguments.name: WEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the type of weight for observations

arguments.name: ATEWGT
arguments.description: uses inverse probability of treatment weighting (IPTW). These weights are appropriate for estimation of the ATE. You can use the STABILIZE= option to request the use of stabilized inverse probability of treatment weights.

arguments.name: ATTWGT
arguments.description: uses ATT weighting (also called weighting by odds) to weight the control group up to the treatment group. These weights are appropriate for estimation of the ATT.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: designates the first ordered level as the treated group

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: designates the last ordered level as the treated group

arguments.name: 'level'
arguments.description: specifies the treated level for the binary treatment variable in quotation marks

statements.name: STRATA
statements.description: divides observations in the support region into strata based on propensity scores

arguments.name: KEY=
arguments.description: specifies how to use the observations to construct the strata

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: requests that each stratum contain approximately the same number of total units, which can be in either the treated group or the control group

arguments.name: TREATED
arguments.description: requests that each stratum contain approximately the same number of units in the treated group

arguments.name: NSTRATA=
arguments.description: specifies the number of strata, where n is greater than or equal to 2

arguments.name: STRATUMWGT=
arguments.description: specifies the type of stratum weights that the PSMATCH procedure uses to combine stratum-specific statistics in the assessment of variable balance after stratification

arguments.name: TOTAL
arguments.description: uses the proportions of total units (treated and control units combined) in the strata as the weights. These weights sum up to one and are appropriate for estimating the ATE.

arguments.name: TREATED
arguments.description: uses the proportions of treated units in the strata as the weights. These weights sum up to one and are appropriate for estimating the ATT.
